Harry Guánchez confía en brazos de los Leones
06 Nov 2019, 02:06 by Vicente Vasquez
Leones del Caracas afrontaron el primer partido del calendario de la zafra 2019-20 como cualquier otro, al salir al terreno con ansias de trascender, las cuales el mánager Harry Guánchez espera observar cada día. Además, confiado en la nómina que junto a la directiva armó, el piloto melenudo prevé contar con un conjunto que mejore con el transcurso de los partidos.
Sin contar con una figura de extremado peso en la liga, la tropa capitalina posee una alineación balanceada y un cuerpo de lanzadores que promete entregar estabilidad. Además, el mánager espera que la defensiva sea uno de los puntos fuertes de la organización este año, sin dejar a un lado la ofensiva y el pitcheo.
“Creo que el año pasado tuvimos problemas con la defensa. Se cayó en una muy mala racha en un momento determinado y nosotros pusimos mucho énfasis en eso. A lo largo del torneo anterior se perdieron muchos juegos por una carrera. No queremos que eso suceda nuevamente”, comentó el estratega previo al encuentro inaugural contra los Tigres de Aragua en el Estadio Universitario.

Harry Guánchez relies on the arms of the Lions
06 Nov 2019, 02:06 by Vicente Vasquez
Lions of Caracas faced the first game of the 2019-20 harvest calendar like any other, as they left the field eager to transcend, which manager Harry Guánchez hopes to observe every day. In addition, confident in the payroll that he put together with the board, the hairy pilot plans to have a team that improves with the course of the matches.
Without having a figure of extreme weight in the league, the capital troop has a balanced alignment and a body of pitchers that promises to deliver stability. In addition, the manager hopes that the defense is one of the strengths of the organization this year, without leaving aside the offensive and pitching.
“I think we had problems with the defense last year. He fell into a very bad run at a certain moment and we put a lot of emphasis on that. Throughout the previous tournament many games were lost by one race. We don't want that to happen again, ”said the strategist prior to the inaugural meeting against the Aragua Tigers at the University Stadium.
In addition, Guánchez knows that it is too early to give forecasts of what his first week's rotation could offer, but he still trusts that they will gradually execute the plan they have drawn up.
“It is very difficult to make projections at this time. The beginning is always going to be a bit difficult, but game by game they are going to take the heat, ”explained the pilot, who said that any of the starters could even later help as a reliever.
